meanings.definition: An instrument for measuring atmospheric pressure.
meanings.sent1: The baroscope showed that the air pressure was high today.
meanings.sent2: I used the baroscope to check the atmospheric pressure before the storm.
meanings.sent3: The baroscope beeped loudly when the pressure suddenly dropped.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like a finely tuned baroscope, always sensing changes in the environment.
meanings.sent5: The scientist relied on the baroscope to accurately measure the atmospheric pressure.

meanings.definition: A device used to detect changes in air pressure.
meanings.sent1: With the baroscope in hand, he could easily notice any air pressure variations.
meanings.sent2: The baroscope beeped when the air pressure started to rise rapidly.
meanings.sent3: The baroscope seemed to have a mind of its own, reacting to every little change in pressure.
meanings.sent4: Her ears were like a sensitive baroscope, picking up on the slightest changes in air pressure.
meanings.sent5: The baroscope's alarm alerted us to the sudden drop in air pressure.

meanings.definition: A tool for monitoring barometric pressure.
meanings.sent1: The baroscope helped us keep track of the barometric pressure throughout the day.
meanings.sent2: Using the baroscope, we could easily monitor the changes in barometric pressure.
meanings.sent3: The baroscope hummed softly as it continuously monitored the barometric pressure.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like a baroscope, always watching the barometric pressure readings.
meanings.sent5: The baroscope's digital display made it simple to read the barometric pressure measurements.
